news.title: Headache for Michéal Martin as support gathers in Fianna Fáil to nominate Bertie Ahern for presidency
news.summary: Support is gathering pace within Fianna Fáil to put Bertie Ahern forward as its candidate for the presidential election.

news.title: Leaving Cert results: Changes have kicked in, with fewer students at higher level achieving H1s
news.summary: A total of 65,444 Leaving Cert students will receive their results today as grades have started to slide back from pandemic-era peaks for the first time.

news.title: The college degrees that can lead to six-figure salaries in AI-proof jobs
news.summary: The Leaving Cert results are out and college offers are around the corner. Will three or four years of lectures and tens of thousands of euro really equip students for a labour market in which artificial intelligence is advancing at breakneck speed?

news.title: Conor McKeon: Where the GAA draws the line and at what cost to the association is not clear
news.summary: Where is the line? The precipice? The border between acceptable and unacceptable sponsorship? The moral boiling point where money is too hot, too tainted, too bloodied?

news.title: ‘They will all be pushed under the one umbrella’ – concerned mother says new special schools policy is causing chaos
news.summary: A mother has said she fears her four-year-old daughter, who has Down syndrome, will be “funnelled into a mainstream school” without the appropriate supports due to policy changes by the Department of Education.

news.title: Erik Menendez denied parole after 35 years in prison for parents' murder
news.summary: Erik Menendez, who along with his brother Lyle has served 35 years of a life prison term for fatally shooting their parents as they watched television in their Beverly Hills, California, home in 1989, was denied parole on Thursday.

news.title: ‘It feels like we’re being ignored’ – family facing eviction after council puts tenant-in-situ scheme on hold
news.summary: A Dublin family trying to stay in their home of seven years have less than three weeks before being evicted after a council scheme they were trying to avail of was paused.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s reviews on the road: The best places to eat in the northwest, from the hills of Donegal down through lakeland Cavan
news.summary: It’s also the perfect time to start planning an Indian summer trip for September or October. There are more availability in hotels, several food festivals happening, and not as many people on the roads.

news.title: ‘I want to study law so badly, it’s all I want’ –  student hopes to get enough Leaving Cert points to work in human rights
news.summary: An 18-year-old who has been studying hard since summer last year is hoping she will get the points today to help her become a humanitarian lawyer.

news.title: Bill Linnane: How I bribed my 17-year-old son to come on a week-long family holiday with us
news.summary: Convincing a teenager to be anywhere in public with you is hard. Convincing them to go on holiday with you for a week is even harder. And it is harder again to convince them to go on holiday with you when you are holidaying in Ireland.
